paint.shared.utils

Class CsvUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • paint.shared.utils.CsvUtils

  • public final class CsvUtils
extends Object
    Utility class for common CSV file operations such as concatenation, record counting, and column modification.

    This class is stateless and cannot be instantiated.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Counts the number of records in a CSV file where the column "Process Flag" has a value considered as true.
      static void main(String[] args)

    • Method Detail

      • countProcessed

        public static int countProcessed(Path filePath)
        Counts the number of records in a CSV file where the column "Process Flag" has a value considered as true.

        Accepted truthy values are: "true", "yes", "y", and "1" (case-insensitive).

        Parameters:
        filePath - path to the CSV file
        Returns:
        number of records marked as processed; returns 0 if no valid "Process Flag" column is found

      • concatenateCsvFiles

        public static void concatenateCsvFiles(List<Path> inputFiles,
                                       Path outputFile,
                                       boolean deleteInputs)
                                throws IOException
        Concatenates multiple CSV files into a single CSV file, preserving headers.

        The output file includes one header row (from the first valid input file) and all data rows from subsequent files. Optionally, the input files can be deleted after successful concatenation.

        Parameters:
        inputFiles - list of input CSV file paths
        outputFile - target output file path
        deleteInputs - if true, delete input files after processing
        Throws:
        IOException - if any I/O error occurs during reading or writing

      • concatenateNamedCsvFiles

        public static void concatenateNamedCsvFiles(Path projectPath,
                                            String fileName,
                                            List<String> experimentNames)
                                     throws IOException
        Concatenates CSV files located in subdirectories of a given project path.

        Each subdirectory corresponds to an experiment and contains a CSV file with the specified fileName. The resulting concatenated CSV file is written to the root project directory.

        Parameters:
        projectPath - base directory containing experiment subdirectories
        fileName - CSV filename to concatenate from each subdirectory
        experimentNames - list of experiment directory names
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs during processing

      • addCase

        public static void addCase(Path root,
                           String fileName,
                           List<String> experimentNames,
                           String caseName)
                    throws IOException
        Adds or updates a "Case" column in CSV files within the specified experiment subdirectories.

        If the column exists, its values are overwritten. If not, it is appended to the end of the record. Each processed file is atomically replaced after writing the updated version.

        Parameters:
        root - base path containing experiment subdirectories
        fileName - target CSV filename within each subdirectory
        experimentNames - list of experiment subdirectory names
        caseName - value to assign to the "Case" column
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs during processing

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws IOException
        Demonstrates the use of CSV utility methods: adding a "Case" column and concatenating experiment CSV files.
        Parameters:
        args - command-line arguments (unused)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs during processing
